message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the relationship between the Earth's orbit and weather patterns. As the Earth orbits the Sun, different places on Earth receive different amounts of sunlight and heat. This variation in sunlight and heat leads to different weather patterns in various locations. Option (B) is incorrect because weather is not consistent worldwide due to the different angles of sunlight and heat distribution. Option (C) is also incorrect because there can be similarities in weather patterns across different regions. Option (D) is incorrect because not all places on Earth have snow.

This question requires basic knowledge about the Earth's orbit and its effect on weather patterns. As the Earth orbits the Sun, different places on the Earth receive varying amounts of sunlight, causing differences in temperature and atmospheric conditions. These variations in temperature and atmospheric conditions lead to different weather patterns in different places. Option (B) is incorrect because weather is not consistent worldwide due to the Earth's tilt and orbit. Option (C) is incorrect because weather patterns can be similar or different depending on location. Option (D) is incorrect because not all places on Earth experience snow.
